and let's get straight down to the point right so we're going to grab some
synthetic rope so it should be synthetic and I've grabbed yellow for a very
specific reason and we just want to cut off a lengthy piece and unravel it so
this one has three chords in it thicker rope would have more chords but you want
to make sure that you get each cord unraveled there we want some baking
paper and a piece of cardstock so get about an inch of one of the cords and
cut it off twist it on one end place a blob of hot glue on the baking paper and
hold the the twisted end in the hot glue until it cures so it should stand up on
its own like this do as many as you like of course you buy a huge thing of rope
you will have a lot so that's what the little base looks like teased out of the
synthetic strands because what we're going to do now is grab a pair of
scissors and we're going to vary the lengths of these strands so just go
around those randomly cutting things to different lengths so that everything
doesn't look like you just cut it all in one spot we want a kind of a natural
feel to the length of these grasses so then once you've done that to all of
them grab of some green paint and paint three-quarters of the way up from the
base towards the top of the grass and do that on a card stock because we're going
to use that in the next video so do this for all of them 3/4 away two-thirds of
the way up and on the base we're going to do some brown on that hot glue base
and you can bleed that Brown into the base of the grass as well the the lower
ends of the grass okay so give it a sort of a mud or sand look so continue on
that through all of the pieces that you've created and now what we're going
to do is grab long length of the same unraveled
synthetic rope wrap it around your fingers two or three fingers grab some
rip off some of the band-aid of crafting the masking tape and wind it around the
center so you've got what you're like your grandma's knitting all rolled up in
the middle and then using your scissors cut all the loops so make sure you get
every single loop that there is cut that off and just make sure you go through
and check that you've got them all and then cut down the middle so now we have
two bunches of large clump of grass or Reed's big blob of hot glue on the
baking paper or parchment papers and maybe called in your country and massage
the grass into that and allow it to cure so once you've done that you then
unravel the masking tape if a little bit is left behind at end that doesn't
really matter once we painted all sort of hide all that again
vary the lengths of the different strands by using a scissors and randomly
cutting the various lengths and tease out the strands with your fingers so the
reason why we have used yellow obviously is to get the dry grass look at the top
and the reason we have used synthetic twine as opposed to a regular twine is
that it actually stands up a lot easier on its own because of the substance that
it is when I did this with string and other things it didn't look as good and
you also had to bathe it in color and other ends I've seen other people do
this as well but the synthetic rope I think really is much quicker the paint
dries pretty easily and you don't really need to worry about too much mess other
than the offcuts from shaving the grass lengths so on the
actual war game board we are then going to visit around the pond I'm just going
to place all the grasses wherever I see fit and the large ones use a little bit
extra hot glue to put that in place so this starts to look really really good
as you here with a little dry top you can even
have that sort of read look where you've cut it as well that sort of thicker ends
and it's really starting to take shape now so just repeat the same process
across all your other boards where ever you want to place a little bits of grass
and whatever you can of course vary the lengths so you do not have to maintain
the same length throughout you can make it shorter you can make it longer all
that kind of stuff so as we travel through to our final board the riverine
board you can see now just in amongst the rocks and that sort of thing you can
